predicate.note: Frames file for 'count' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet classes 29.2, 29.6.

example.name: Count von Count
example.text: But this is a production designed and directed by Franco Zeffirelli and paid for by Sybil Harrington, who *trace* has no need *trace* to count her pennies, unlike Violetta, down to 20 louis at the opera's end.

role.descr: theme, thing being included in some group

example.name: with group
example.text: Mr. Achenbaum has counted among his clients some of the most visible blue-chip advertisers in the country, including Nissan, Toyota, Seagram and Backer Spielvogel clients Hyundai and J.P. Morgan.
example.arg: some of the most visible blue-chip advertisers in the country, including Nissan, Toyota, Seagram and Backer Spielvogel clients Hyundai and J.P. Morgan

example.name: no group
example.text: Not counting the extraordinary charge, the company said it would have had a net loss of $3.1 million, or seven cents a share.

roleset.name: rely, depend

example.name: no secondary predication
example.text: Before the union rejected the company's offer and the strike was launched with the graveyard shift of Oct. 4, Boeing had been counting on turning 96 aircraft out the door in the present period.
example.arg: turning 96 aircraft out the door in the present period

example.name: with secondary predication
example.text: Commodore had been counting on its consumer business to stay sufficiently healthy to support its efforts in other areas -- mainly in getting schools and businesses to use its Amiga, which has slick graphics yet has been slow to catch on because it isn't compatible with Apple Computer Inc. or International Business Machines Corp. hardware.
example.arg: to stay sufficiently healthy to support its efforts in other areas -- mainly in getting schools and businesses to use its Amiga, which has slick graphics yet has been slow to catch on because it isn't compatible with Apple Computer Inc. or International Business Machines Corp. hardware

roleset.note: There's as least one example where treebank misparses "count on" as a phrasal verb rather than verb+preposition. Use [count] [on] as the predicate in that/those example(s).

example.name: positive
example.text: `` What counts is the bottom line . ''
